ygData.subject: Re: Fw: [EQMagicians] Just a thought..
ygData.msgSnippet: ive timed it a few times where my casting completed just after the pet died. its not easy, and it doesnt always work (fizzles are fun too).  generally i go the
ygData.messageBody:
ive timed it a few times where my casting completed just after the pet died.
its not easy, and it doesnt always work (fizzles are fun too). generally
i go the safer route and pick and choose my enemies (i solo a lot), and if
you kill all that mana on a pet you may be S.O.L., especially if you have
dark pact going when you have to go hand to hand =)

belphenor
lodge of the dead
neriak, fennin ro

>From: "Scott J. Geertgens" <geertges@...>
>Reply-To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com
>To: EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] Fw: [EQMagicians] Just a thought..
>Date: Mon, 10 May 1999 08:42:10 -0600 (MDT)
>
>From: "Scott J. Geertgens" <geertges@...>
>
>
> > I've never tried this, but could you sic your pet on a monster, run a
>goodly
> > distance away, then when your pet dies summon a second one to send after
>the
> > beast?
>
> I've heard this is a viable tactic for higher level Shadow Knights to
>use, but I'm unsure if necromancers can cast the summons at the same speed
>to make this worthwhile. Would be interesting to find out :)
>
>Valdus
>
